history.content:
Dear students and teaching staff, 

 

We would like to inform you of an extracurricular opportunity. Undergraduate Laboratory at Berkeley (ULAB) is a STEM education startup that gently introduces new students to research at Berkeley as well as provides a social/mentoring experience for advanced undergraduate researchers to learn from each other and develop professionally.

 

ULAB is looking for mentors for their Data Science Lab to lead independent research projects for teams of freshman students. We are looking for students with a strong foundation in Data Science. A statistics, computer science, or data science background is preferred, and relevant research or project experience. Mentors will assist a small group of students in grasping fundamental concepts within the respective field and later on, help the students develop and carry out a complete research project over the course of the semester. Mentors should be willing to commit 4-5 hours per week. Specific work hours are flexible, and mentors can earn up to 2 P/NP upper-division EE/CS units.

 

For more information regarding ULAB and applications, please visit the website at ulab.berkeley.edu or email inquiries to alanlp@berkeley.edu. Thank you. 

 

If you are interested, please fill out this Google Form: https://forms.gle/TDe6YmYeKY3VkUNC6
history.subject: Interested in Mentoring Student Research?
